results.title: Crucifixion: theme and variations
results.creator_credit: Filmmakers, George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description: Interpretation by three Flemish artists, of the theme of the Crucifixion from the original paintings in the Johnson Collection at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The following are studied: “Christ carrying the Cross” by the Master of the Turin Adoration (1490-1510); “Christ on the Cross and the Virgin and St. John” by Roger van der Weyden (1399-1464); and “Pieta” by Gerard David (1460-1523). Commentary by Murvyn Vye.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Filmmakers, George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer

results.title: Crows and sparrows = Wuya yu maque [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kunlun Film Company and Zheng Junli
results.brief_description: Production of this landmark film began in 1948 but was halted by the Kuomintang authorities when they discovered that the submitted script was not being followed and was heavily anti-KMT. In the interval before it resumed production in September 1949, it was rewritten to be even more hostile to KMT authorities. The film centres on the joys and disasters experienced by the inhabitants of a boarding house comandeered by a KMT official. The film’s basic form is derived from the modern drama tradition of China. The casual naturalism has been compared with neo-realism. Cast includes Zhao Dan, Wu Yin ans Sun Daolin. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Crown of righteousness
results.creator_credit: GHW Production, Ray Hoke and Norman Walker
results.brief_description: Paul’s captivity in Rome. Ephroditus bring him gifts from the Church in Phillippi. A reconstruction of the events relation to St Paul’s re-arrest and hie trial before Nero (2 Timothy IV 7-8).

results.title: Crow boy (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Croupier
results.creator_credit: Channel Four Films, Filmstiftung NRW, WDR La Sept Cinema, Arte, Jonathan Cavendish and Mike Hodges
results.brief_description: Mike Hodges’ slow-burning “Croupier” is the tale of one man’s addiction to watching people lose; and whose detached observation of the sleaze and depression in the world of gambling becomes his only means of self-fulfillment. Jack Manfred (Clive Owen) is a former croupier and struggling writer lured back to casino work by his estranged father. Therein he encounters without any real surprise the business of letting people lose, and soon his relationships with those close to him take on a similar sense of self-interest and subtle cruelty. Interwoven with the robberies, intrigue and exoticism is a commentary on the alienation bred by gambling and the lifestyle it entails. Cast also includes Gina McKee, Kate Hardie and Paul Reynolds.

results.title: Crosstalk
results.creator_credit: Wall to Wall, Filmside Productions, Errol Sullivan and Mark Egerton
results.brief_description: A computer expert crippled in a suspicious accident is now confined to a flat with a nurse. He was originally investigating the malfunctioning of a super computer but now finds himself menaced by the same technology.

results.title: Crossroads Rock Concert
results.creator_credit: Salvation Army, Salvation Army. Australia Southern Territory and Richard Hodder
results.brief_description: Three Christian rock groups gig together in aid of Salvation Army’s Crossroads Program for Homeless Youth, interspersed with modern parables about being young and different from the crowd. “Crossroads” is a video about, and for, contemporary Christian youth.

results.title: Crossroads of life
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and Henri Storck
results.brief_description: Hihglights several cases of children with serious problems, who are helped to understand their needs and become healthier people. After becoming delinquent, they are treated in a children’s institution. Scenes show therapeutic work to help them relieve aggressive feelings. International cooperation to improve methods of prevention, observation and treatment of delinquency is urged.

results.title: Crossroads
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Mark Carliner and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Long ago, Willie Brown bargained his soul with the Devil at the crossroads in return for fame. Gifted young guitarist Eugene (Ralph Maccio) will do anything to play the blues like his legendary hero and travels across country where he meets the now old and cantankerous Willie. Together they journey to the fated crossroads and Eugene learns that to really play the blues, you must live them first. Joe Seneca and Jami Gertz also star in this production which features an incredible soundtrack by Ry Cooder.
